summary: This document is a chain of emails from August 2019 between officials at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) regarding the sharing of Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) information related to the Jeffrey Epstein case. It shows coordination between prosecutors and financial crime investigators.

persons.name: Wilson Alexander
persons.context: Appears as a recipient of an email introduction from a co-chief, indicating he is part of the Epstein prosecution team at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
keyFacts: In August 2019, prosecutors from the SDNY Epstein team were coordinating with FinCEN to share and review Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) information related to the case.
The correspondence indicates FinCEN had identified financial information relevant to the Epstein investigation and wanted to ensure prosecutors were aware of it.
The email chain shows a formal process for inter-agency information sharing regarding financial crimes linked to the Epstein case.
